title: Part D

descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the wage rate the firm will pay will decrease and explains that a decrease in the price of plumbing equipment will result in a decrease in the demand for plumbers because plumbing equipment and workers are substitutes in providing plumbing services. A decrease in the demand for workers will decrease the market wage and therefore decrease the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

· States that the demand curve for plumbers by Chloe’s Plumbing Services will stay the same in the short run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP), which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and in the short run there is no change in the price of the service or the marginal product.

Or states that the demand curve for plumbers by Chloe’s Plumbing Services will decrease in the long run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP) which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and a decrease in the price of an input will increase the supply of plumbing services in the market, which will decrease the market price of plumbing services, and therefore will decrease the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.
